results.definition: catch the scent of; get wind of
examples: The dog nosed out the drugs

results.definition: search or inquire in a meddlesome way
a projecting spout from which a fluid is discharged
the organ of smell and entrance to the respiratory tract; the prominent part of the face of man or other mammals
examples: he has a cold in the nose

results.definition: advance the forward part of with caution
examples: She nosed the car into the left lane

results.definition: a front that resembles a human nose (especially the front of an aircraft)
examples: the nose of the rocket heated up on reentry
he has a nose for good deals
my horse lost the race by a nose
keep your nose out of it

results.definition: push or move with the nose
the front or forward projection of a tool or weapon
examples: he ducked under the nose of the gun

results.definition: the sense of smell (especially in animals)
examples: the hound has a good nose
